snippet: Scientists say a disease destroying entire crops of cassava has spread out of East Africa into the heart of the continent, attacking plants as far south as Angola and threatening to move west into Nigeria.
abstract: Scientists say disease destroying entire crops of cassava has spread out of East Africa into heart of the continent, attacking plants as far south as Angola and threatening to move west into Nigeria, world's biggest producer of root; resulting food shortages could be devastating if disease is not stopped.
lead_paragraph: Scientists say a disease destroying entire crops of cassava has spread out of East Africa into the heart of the continent, attacking plants as far south as Angola and threatening to move west into Nigeria.
